title: Dutch Pro-Farmer Party Sweeps Elections, Upsetting the Status Quo
description: The surprise victory is widely seen as a protest vote against Prime Minister Mark Rutte’s government and some of his policies, including a goal to slash nitrogen emissions, which many say will imperil farming operations.

title: Singing and Banging, French Lawmakers Vow to Stop Pension Change
description: Parties from the left and right erupted in anger after learning of the government’s plans to adopt the measure without a vote.

title: What’s Next for Opponents of Macron’s Retirement Plan?
description: A protest at Place de la Concorde in Paris began as a jovial scene, but devolved as night fell and violent protesters clashed with police.

title: Macron Pushes Through Law in France Raising Retirement Age
description: Lacking parliamentary support, the French president used a special measure to circumvent a vote, a step likely to further enrage opponents.

title: Your Friday Briefing: Macron Pushes Through Pension Bill
description: Also, Poland says it will give Ukraine warplanes and Japan extends a hand to South Korea.

title: An Effort to Resolve Israel’s Impasse Stalls on How to Pick Judges
description: Mediators say the government and its opponents agree on some changes to a judiciary overhaul plan that has divided the country. But the process of appointing new judges remains a major obstacle.

title: Biden to Name Nevada’s Spirit Mountain Area a National Monument
description: The biologically diverse land is central to the creation story of the Mojave and other tribes. Energy companies have also identified it as a prime location for wind or solar installations.

title: On Italy’s Coast, Empathy Mixes With Frustration After Migrant Tragedy
description: As bodies continue washing up in a poverty-stricken part of Calabria, some local residents wonder whether a hard-line government understands what drives migration.

title: HelloFresh to Stop Buying Coconut Milk From Thailand Amid Claims of Monkey Labor
description: The meal kit company’s decision follows an advocacy group’s report claiming that some monkeys in Thailand are forced to climb trees and pick the fruit.

title: 3 Dogs Die After Eating Poisoned Meatballs at a Race in France
description: The poisonings took place at the French canicross championships, in which people run or cycle while attached to their dogs.

title: Poland Says It Foiled a Russian Spy Ring
description: The sabotage, the Polish interior minister said, was planned “at the request of Russian intelligence” and “aimed at paralyzing the supply of equipment, weapons and aid to Ukraine.”

title: 10 Drums of Nuclear Material Are Missing From Libya Site, U.N. Agency Says
description: The U.N. nuclear watchdog said that 2.5 tons of natural uranium concentrate was unaccounted for, but that the ore itself posed little radiation hazard.

title: How Macron Is Using the French Constitution for His Pension Overhaul
description: A move used often by President Emmanuel Macron can push bills through the lower house of Parliament without a vote. But detractors view it as an undemocratic tool to strong-arm lawmakers.

title: U.K. Bans TikTok on Government Devices
description: The move reflects fears in Britain and elsewhere in the West that the popular app’s Chinese ownership could share user information with Beijing.

title: Live Updates: Macron Will Push Pension Reform Bill Through Without Vote
description: President Emmanuel Macron, shy of support in Parliament to pass his contentious proposal to raise the retirement age, will use a constitutional measure to enact the bill without a vote.

title: China Wine Tariff Pushes Australia’s Grape Growers Into Crisis
description: Two years later, they’re suffering from a glut of red wine and plummeting grape prices with no overseas market big enough to fill the gap.

title: Live Updates: U.S. Releases Video Footage of Drone Incident
description: The 42-second clip shows Russian jets spraying the Reaper drone with what the Pentagon says is jet fuel, before it crashed into the Black Sea on Tuesday.

title: China’s Answer to ChatGPT Gets an Artificial Debut and Disappoints
description: The promised “live” demonstration of the bot had, in fact, been prerecorded. Shares of Baidu, the company behind the technology, tumbled in Hong Kong.

title: March Madness Is Here
description: A preview for fans and non-fans alike.

title: 6 Cities on 5 Continents That Are Reimagining Urban Life
description: What we can learn from creative city initiatives, from Sydney to Paris.

title: Protests in Peru: How Police Used Lethal Force Against Demonstrators
description: A New York Times investigation found that the country’s police and military fired lethal ammunition at unarmed civilians during protests in December and January.

title: Ukraine Burns Through Ammunition in Bakhmut, Risking Future Fights
description: The military is using thousands of artillery shells a day as it tries to hold the eastern city, which could jeopardize a planned springtime campaign.

title: France Holds Its Breath Over Tense Pension Vote After Large Protests
description: In a test for President Emmanuel Macron’s political goals, lawmakers will decide on his proposal to raise the retirement age for most workers by two years, to 64.

title: Two Acquittals, One 18-Month Sentence in Indonesia Soccer Disaster
description: The defendants, all police officers, were charged with criminal negligence in connection with the October stampede that killed 135 people.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Here’s what you need to know.

title: TikTok Pushed by U.S. to Resolve National Security Concerns
description: The demand hardens the White House’s stance toward the popular video app, which is owned by the Chinese internet company ByteDance.
